intro: Wurmbea inframediana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yellowstar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the genus Wurmbea within the family Asparagaceae, and is characterized by its tuberous roots and narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow, star-shaped flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
